segment.source: Authors: José Fischer, Noelia Ruiz Martínez
segment.target: Authors: José Fischer, Noelia Ruiz Martínez

segment.source: This add-on is used to customize toast notifications.
segment.target: This add-on is used to customize toast notifications.

segment.source: You can choose to read the whole notification or just the application which sends it, and if notifications will be spoken, displayed in braille or both.
segment.target: You can choose to read the whole notification or just the application which sends it, and if notifications will be spoken, displayed in braille or both.

segment.source: Go to NVDA's menu, Preferences submenu, Settings, and select the Custom Notifications category. There you'll find the following controls:
segment.target: Go to NVDA's menu, Preferences submenu, Settings, and select the Custom Notifications category. There you'll find the following controls:

segment.source: A checkbox to choose if notifications should be truncated, checked by default.
segment.target: A checkbox to choose if notifications should be truncated, checked by default.

segment.source: An edit box to set the start limit of notifications, empty by default.
segment.target: An edit box to set the start limit of notifications, empty by default.

segment.source: An edit box to set the end limit of notifications, ", " (comma space) by default.
segment.target: An edit box to set the end limit of notifications, ", " (comma space) by default.

segment.source: A list of checkboxes to select if notifications should be spoken and displayed in braille, both checked by default.
segment.target: A list of checkboxes to select if notifications should be spoken and displayed in braille, both checked by default.

segment.source: An edit box to type a text to send a test notification, to get an idea of how NVDA will present toasts.
segment.target: An edit box to type a text to send a test notification, to get an idea of how NVDA will present toasts.

segment.source: If the previous edit box contains text, a button to send a notification, so you can test if your selected settings work fine for you.
segment.target: If the previous edit box contains text, a button to send a notification, so you can test if your selected settings work fine for you.

segment.source: You can assign a gesture to open the add-on settings panel, and to toggle various add-on settings, from NVDA's menu, Preferences submenu, Input gestures dialog, Configuration category.
segment.target: You can assign a gesture to open the add-on settings panel, and to toggle various add-on settings, from NVDA's menu, Preferences submenu, Input gestures dialog, Configuration category.

segment.source: In the add-on settings panel, added an edit box to set the start limit of notifications.
segment.target: In the add-on settings panel, added an edit box to set the start limit of notifications.
